info.title: Praxis Backend
info.description: A comprehensive Python-based platform to automate and manage laboratory     workflows.

post.description:
Authenticate user and return access token.

Args:
    credentials: User login credentials (username and password)
    db: Database session

Returns:
    LoginResponse with user data and JWT token

Raises:
    HTTPException: If authentication fails (401 Unauthorized)

Logout endpoint.

Note: JWT tokens are stateless, so logout is handled client-side
by removing the token from storage. This endpoint exists for
API consistency and can be extended to implement token blacklisting
if needed in the future.

Returns:
    Success message

schema.title: Response Logout Api V1 Auth Logout Post

get.description:
Get the current authenticated user's information.

This is a protected route that requires a valid JWT token.

Args:
    current_user: Current authenticated user (injected by dependency)

Returns:
    UserResponse with current user's data

schema.title: Response Get Multi Api V1 Data Outputs Outputs Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Data Outputs Well Outputs Get

post.description:
Start a new protocol run.

Creates a protocol run record and begins execution. If simulation_mode is True,
the protocol will run without triggering actual hardware actions.

Cancel a running or queued protocol run.

Releases reserved assets and updates the run status to CANCELLED.

TODO: Add permission check - only admin or run owner can cancel.

get.description:
Get list of active/queued protocol runs.

Returns runs with status: PENDING, PREPARING, QUEUED, RUNNING.

schema.title: Response Get Protocol Queue Api V1 Protocols Runs Queue Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Protocols Definitions Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Protocols Runs Records Get

get.description:
Check protocol compatibility against all machines.

Returns a list of compatibility results for each available machine.

schema.title: Response Get Protocol Compatibility Api V1 Protocols  Accession Id  Compatibility Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Workcell  Get

get.summary: Get facet values with counts for filtering
get.description:
Return unique values and counts for filterable resource definition fields.

Used for dynamically generating filter chips in the frontend.
Returns facets for: plr_category, vendor, num_items, plate_type, well_volume_ul, tip_volume_ul.

Supports dynamic filtering: passing a filter (e.g. plr_category='plate') will update
the counts for other facets (e.g. only showing vendors that make plates).

schema.title: Response Get Resource Definition Facets Api V1 Resources Definitions Facets Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Resources Definitions Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Resources  Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Decks  Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Decks Types Get

get.summary: Get facet values with counts for machine filtering
get.description:
Return unique values and counts for filterable machine definition fields.

Returns facets for: machine_category, manufacturer.

schema.title: Response Get Machine Definition Facets Api V1 Machines Definitions Facets Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Machines Definitions Get
Response Get Multi Api V1 Machines  Get

patch.description: Update the status of a machine.

get.description: Scan for connected hardware devices including serial ports, USB, network, and simulators.
Scan for devices connected via serial/USB ports.

schema.title: Response Discover Serial Api V1 Hardware Discover Serial Get

get.description: Get list of available PyLabRobot simulator backends.

schema.title: Response Discover Simulators Api V1 Hardware Discover Simulators Get

post.description: Establish connection to a discovered hardware device.
Close connection to a hardware device.

get.description: Get list of currently active hardware connections.

schema.title: Response List Connections Api V1 Hardware Connections Get

post.description: Keep a connection alive by sending a heartbeat.

get.description: Get the current state of a specific connection.

post.summary: Register a device as a machine
post.description: Register a discovered hardware device as a machine in the system.
Execute a command on a connected hardware device.

Synchronize all PyLabRobot type definitions and protocol definitions with the database.

This endpoint triggers a full discovery and synchronization process for all
known PyLabRobot resources, machines, decks, and protocol definitions.
It should be used to ensure the database reflects the latest available
definitions from the connected PyLabRobot environment and protocol sources.

schema.title: Response Get Multi Api V1 Scheduler Entries Get

put.description: Update the status of a schedule entry.
Update the priority of a schedule entry.

get.description:
List all asset reservations.

Admin endpoint for inspecting current reservation state. By default, only
shows active reservations (PENDING, RESERVED, ACTIVE). Set include_released=true
to see all reservations including released ones.

delete.description:
Release asset reservations by asset key.

Admin endpoint for manually clearing stuck reservations. This releases
all active reservations for the specified asset key.

The asset_key format is typically "type:name", e.g., "asset:my_plate".

Use force=true to also release ACTIVE reservations (use with caution as
this may interrupt running protocols).

parameters.name: force

schema.description: Force release even for reservations in ACTIVE state
schema.title: Force

parameters.description: Force release even for reservations in ACTIVE state

post.description: Save the current session history as a protocol.

DataViewMetadataModel.title: DataViewMetadataModel
DataViewMetadataModel.description:
Defines a data view required by a protocol for input data.

Data views allow protocols to declare what input data they need in a structured way.
They can reference:
- PLR state data (e.g., liquid volume tracking, resource positions)
- Function data outputs from previous protocol runs (e.g., plate reader reads)

Schema validation errors during protocol setup generate warnings but do not
block protocol execution.

A general configuration for methods that follow the pattern:

WorkcellResponse.title: WorkcellResponse
WorkcellResponse.description:
Represents a workcell for API responses.

This model extends `WorkcellBase` by adding system-generated identifiers
and timestamps for creation and last update, suitable for client-facing
responses.

WorkcellStatusEnum.title: WorkcellStatusEnum
WorkcellStatusEnum.description:
Enumeration for workcell status.

This enum defines the possible statuses a workcell can have.
